name: Data_Exploration
description: Functions exploring the data: searches, highlights some element, ...
label: Data Exploration

name: Search_TS_Pattern
description: Search a pattern in a TS selection. The pattern is defined as a TS selection.
label: Search TS Pattern

name: TS_Pattern_Matching
description: Apply the spark-distributed pattern-matching algorithm: this algorithm searches the TS pattern defined by fid_pattern argument into the TS dataset specified by search_target. Current version 1, the target is retricted to the first TS of the dataset.

inputs.name: search_target
inputs.label: DSname
inputs.description: The search_target: defines the searching area. Dataset name,

parameters.name: fid_pattern
parameters.description: The functional identifier of the pattern: pattern is a TS selection
parameters.label: Pattern

parameters.name: rate_sliding
parameters.description: The computed translation of search window: expressed as a percentage of the pattern size (number of points): 1.0 is coding 100%
parameters.label: Rate sliding

parameters.name: rate_size_window
parameters.description: The maximal length of search window, important for DTW and FASTDTW distances: expressed as a percentage of pattern size (number of points): 1.0 is coding 100% (Not applicable for MANHATTAN distance)
parameters.label: Rate size

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: The name of the metric used for scoring: 'DTW' 'FAST_DTW' or 'MANHATTAN'
parameters.label: Metric

parameters.name: scores_limitation
parameters.description: The demanded number of first best scores
parameters.label: Scores limit

parameters.name: normalize_mode
parameters.description: The demanded normalizing mode applied before comparing the pattern to the local target area. Available in current version: 'NO_NORM' disables the normalizing pre-processing, or 'MEAN_VARIANCE' sets mean to zero and scales std-deviation to 1 -when possible-
parameters.label: Normalize mode

outputs.name: result
outputs.label: Patterns
outputs.description: Pattern-matching result, grouping the best scores and intervals
